isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - TOOLS - DWYER SLACK TUBE MANOMETER

svcsubproc.title: Description
svcsubproc.para: The manometer is a U shaped tube with a scale mounted between the legs of the U. When portability of the Model 200 Pressure Test Kit is not required, this manometer can be used to measure either low pressure or vacuum (intake restriction, crankcase pressure or exhaust back pressure) and must be filled with water.

svcsubproc.title: Filling the Manometer
svcsubproc.para: Fill the manometer with only good drinking water without additives, except for some colored water vegetable dye that enables the tester to read the scale easier. With both legs of the manometer open to the atmosphere, fill the tube until the top of the fluid column is near the zero mark on the scale. Shake the tube to eliminate any air bubbles.

note.para: Do not use antifreeze solutions, soda pop, tonic, etc. to fill manometer. Increased density will cause false readings.

step1.para: Support the manometer vertically. Be sure the fluid level line is in line with the zero indicator on the graduated scale.
Connect one leg of the manometer to the pressure source or vacuum. The Leave the other leg open to atmospheric pressure.
After starting the engine, allow the engine to reach normal operating temperature and set the engine to High Idle. After approximately 10 seconds check the manometer.

Record the average position of the fluid level when it is above and below the zero indicator. Add the two figures. The sum equals the total column of fluid and represents the crankcase pressure in inches of water.
Compare manometer reading with engine specifications.

note.para: At times both columns of the manometer will not travel the same distance. This is of no concern to the tester as long as the leg not connected to the pressure or vacuum source is open to the atmosphere.

step1.para: Wash the tube thoroughly using a little pure soap and water. Avoid liquid soaps and solvents.
